monogr.title: Pasquils mistresse: or The vvorthie and vnworthie woman : VVith his description and passion of that furie, iealousie
monogr.author: Breton, Nicholas

div.head: ❧ Pasquill, in general, to women.
div.p: YEE that are worthie of honour, I willingly giue it yee: yee that deserue ill, I will pray for yee, that God wil amend yee: but yee that are gratious, be not proud, least yee fallere yee be aware: and yee that are too blame, be not desperate; God is mercifull: among yee all, let none be more pieuish than another, to take ill to her selfe. What is good take it, yee that deserue it: what is ill, I bequeath it to none at all: for, I knowe not her, whome particularly I will touch with imperfections. Some kinde of shadowes I dreamed of, that were like women: which when I awooke, I found nothing such. And therfore, hoping all women will deserue some good thought, or other, I will honour the best, & pray for the worst, and so rest.
